intro: Astracantha cerasocrena, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
